segment.source: Network access Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network access Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users security policy setting.

segment.source: Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users
segment.target: Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines what additional permissions are granted for anonymous connections to the device.
segment.target: This policy setting determines what additional permissions are granted for anonymous connections to the device.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, anonymous users can enumerate the names of domain accounts and shared folders and perform certain other activities.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, anonymous users can enumerate the names of domain accounts and shared folders and perform certain other activities.

segment.source: This capability is convenient, for example, when an administrator wants to grant access to users in a trusted domain that does not maintain a reciprocal trust.
segment.target: This capability is convenient, for example, when an administrator wants to grant access to users in a trusted domain that does not maintain a reciprocal trust.

segment.source: By default, the token that is created for anonymous connections does not include the Everyone SID.
segment.target: By default, the token that is created for anonymous connections does not include the Everyone SID.

segment.source: Therefore, permissions that are assigned to the Everyone group do not apply to anonymous users.
segment.target: Therefore, permissions that are assigned to the Everyone group do not apply to anonymous users.

segment.source: The Everyone SID is added to the token that is created for anonymous connections, and anonymous users can access any resource for which the Everyone group has been assigned permissions.
segment.target: The Everyone SID is added to the token that is created for anonymous connections, and anonymous users can access any resource for which the Everyone group has been assigned permissions.

segment.source: The Everyone SID is removed from the token that is created for anonymous connections.
segment.target: The Everyone SID is removed from the token that is created for anonymous connections.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PolicesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PolicesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: An unauthorized user could anonymously list account names and shared resources and use the information to attempt to guess passwords, perform social engineering attacks, or launch DoS attacks.
segment.target: An unauthorized user could anonymously list account names and shared resources and use the information to attempt to guess passwords, perform social engineering attacks, or launch DoS attacks.

segment.source: Disable the Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users setting.
segment.target: Disable the Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users setting.
